text: Star this issue if you would be interested in a Julia lang SDK for Google Cloud! <https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/180332883> :star:

text:
There is this…

> <https://github.com/JuliaCloud/GoogleCloud.jl>
However it has not been touched in a while really

elements.text: However it has not been touched in a while really

text:
Side-note: If we can get JSON files like this,

> <https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-js/tree/master/apis>
Creating an improved package for GCP would be relatively easy.

elements.text: Side-note: If we can get JSON files like this,

attachments.title: Google API Discovery Service  |  Google Developers
attachments.text: Programmatically read metadata about Google APIs.
attachments.fallback: Google Developers: Google API Discovery Service  |  Google Developers

text:
I have not used GCP in a long long time.
But yeah this looks like what can be used.

Really just need something at minimum which defines:

- What are the API endpoints we can hit?
- What are the parameters for these endpoints, and where do they need to be positioned?

text: I see this as a good idea since it would bring visibility to Julia.

text: Is there something that would require it?

text:
As long as Google has some well-defined files, we can do something similar to how AWS.jl works,

> <https://github.com/JuliaCloud/AWS.jl/blob/master/src/AWSMetadata.jl>
